timeline.message: [DROOLS-5492] Add treemodel + dmn to dmn-pmml example

timeline.bodyText: why the dmn-springboot-example example has been changed?
timeline.author: tarilabs
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -33,10 +33,6 @@
   </dependencyManagement>
 
   <dependencies>
-    <dependency>
-      <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
-      <artifactId>spring-boot-starter</artifactId>

replies.bodyText:
@tarilabs
To fix some failures inside that example (following pmml integration) I had to debug dependency tree, and I found out that this dependency is redundant
org.kie.kogito:dmn-springboot-example:jar:8.0.0-SNAPSHOT
+- org.kie.kogito:kogito-springboot-starter:jar:8.0.0-SNAPSHOT:compile
|  - org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-web:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile
|     +- org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-json:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile
|     - org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-tomcat:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile
- org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-test:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:test
+- org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile
....
and I thought it was better to remove possible source of confusion
replies.author: gitgabrio

replies.bodyText:
I am not sure I follow how this is redundant, further this is based on other SB targeting example.
If you can share more details please, so we can ask others to review the other SB targeting examples?
replies.author: tarilabs

replies.bodyText:
@tarilabs
 kogito-springboot-starter]$ mvn dependency:tree -Dincludes=org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter
[INFO] org.kie.kogito:kogito-springboot-starter:jar:8.0.0-SNAPSHOT
[INFO] - org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-web:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile
[INFO]    - org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile
dmn-springboot-example]$ mvn dependency:tree -Dincludes=org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter -Dverbose
[INFO] org.kie.kogito:dmn-springboot-example:jar:8.0.0-SNAPSHOT
[INFO] +- org.kie.kogito:kogito-springboot-starter:jar:8.0.0-SNAPSHOT:compile
[INFO] |  +- org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-web:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile
[INFO] |  |  +- org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile
[INFO] |  |  - org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-json:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile
[INFO] |  |     - (org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile - omitted for duplicate)
[INFO] |  - org.jboss.resteasy:resteasy-spring-boot-starter:jar:4.6.0.Final:compile
[INFO] |     - (org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile - omitted for duplicate)
[INFO] - org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-test:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:test
[INFO]    - (org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter:jar:2.3.1.RELEASE:compile - scope updated from test; omitted for duplicate)
So inside dmn-springboot-example, even without that declaration,  org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter is already inherited via multiple different paths.
Beside that, the example just works without it, so it is unneeded.
replies.author: gitgabrio

replies.bodyText: So the answer to this question, actually, is: the org.kie.kogito:kogito-springboot-starter provides the org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter already, so declaring that in the example is redundant, the user should just keep org.kie.kogito:kogito-springboot-starter in the pom.xml
replies.author: tarilabs

replies.bodyText:
@tarilabs
Yes, exactly that
"To fix some failures inside that example (following pmml integration) I had to debug dependency tree, and I found out that this dependency is redundant" (followed by the actual inheritance chain, that I thought it would be interesting to read/understand)
Sorry to not be able to express that concept clearly.
replies.author: gitgabrio

timeline.message: [DROOLS-5491] Add Scorecard model to pmml examples

timeline.bodyText: To be removed because it is not tested/supported yet
timeline.author: danielezonca
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,152 @@
+# DMN + PMML +  Quarkus example
+
+## Description
+
+A simple DMN + PMML service.
+
+Demonstrates DMN on Kogito capabilities, including REST interface code generation.
+
+## Installing and Running
+
+### Prerequisites
+
+You will need:
+  - Java 11+ installed
+  - Environment variable JAVA_HOME set accordingly
+  - Maven 3.6.2+ installed
+
+When using native image compilation, you will also need:
+  - [GraalVM 19.3.1](https://github.com/oracle/graal/releases/tag/vm-19.3.1) installed
+  - Environment variable GRAALVM_HOME set accordingly
+  - Note that GraalVM native image compilation typically requires other packages (glibc-devel, zlib-devel and gcc) to be installed too.  You also need 'native-image' installed in GraalVM (using 'gu install native-image'). Please refer to [GraalVM installation documentation](https://www.graalvm.org/docs/reference-manual/aot-compilation/#prerequisites) for more details.
+
+### Compile and Run in Local Dev Mode
+
+```
+mvn clean compile quarkus:dev
+```
+
+### Package and Run in JVM mode
+
+```
+mvn clean package
+java -jar target/dmn-pmml-quarkus-example-runner.jar
+```
+
+or on Windows
+
+```
+mvn clean package
+java -jar target\dmn-pmml-quarkus-example-runner.jar
+```
+
+### Package and Run using Local Native Image
+Note that this requires GRAALVM_HOME to point to a valid GraalVM installation
+
+```
+mvn clean package -Pnative
+```
+
+To run the generated native executable, generated in `target/`, execute
+
+```
+./target/dmn-pmml-quarkus-example-runner
+```
+
+Note: This does not yet work on Windows, GraalVM and Quarkus should be rolling out support for Windows soon.

@@ -0,0 +1,196 @@
+# PMML + Quarkus example
+
+## Description
+
+A simple PMML service
+
+Demonstrates PMML on Kogito capabilities, including REST interface code generation.
+
+## Installing and Running
+
+### Prerequisites
+
+You will need:
+  - Java 11+ installed
+  - Environment variable JAVA_HOME set accordingly
+  - Maven 3.6.2+ installed
+
+When using native image compilation, you will also need:
+  - [GraalVM 19.3.1](https://github.com/oracle/graal/releases/tag/vm-19.3.1) installed
+  - Environment variable GRAALVM_HOME set accordingly
+  - Note that GraalVM native image compilation typically requires other packages (glibc-devel, zlib-devel and gcc) to be installed too.  You also need 'native-image' installed in GraalVM (using 'gu install native-image'). Please refer to [GraalVM installation documentation](https://www.graalvm.org/docs/reference-manual/aot-compilation/#prerequisites) for more details.
+
+### Compile and Run in Local Dev Mode
+
+```
+mvn clean compile quarkus:dev
+```
+
+### Package and Run in JVM mode
+
+```
+mvn clean package
+java -jar target/pmml-quarkus-example-runner.jar
+```
+
+or on Windows
+
+```
+mvn clean package
+java -jar target\pmml-quarkus-example-runner.jar
+```
+
+### Package and Run using Local Native Image
+Note that this requires GRAALVM_HOME to point to a valid GraalVM installation
+
+```
+mvn clean package -Pnative
+```
+
+To run the generated native executable, generated in `target/`, execute
+
+```
+./target/pmml-quarkus-example-runner
+```
+
+Note: This does not yet work on Windows, GraalVM and Quarkus should be rolling out support for Windows soon.

+         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+  <parent>
+    <groupId>org.kie.kogito</groupId>
+    <artifactId>kogito-examples</artifactId>
+    <version>8.0.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+  </parent>
+  <artifactId>dmn-pmml-springboot-example</artifactId>
+  <name>Kogito Example :: DMN :: PMML - Spring Boot</name>
+
+  <properties>
+    <version.org.jpmml>1.5.1</version.org.jpmml>
+  </properties>
+
+  <dependencyManagement>
+    <dependencies>
+      <dependency>
+        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+        <artifactId>spring-boot-dependencies</artifactId>
+        <version>${springboot.version}</version>
+        <type>pom</type>
+        <scope>import</scope>
+      </dependency>
+      <dependency>
+        <groupId>org.kie.kogito</groupId>
+        <artifactId>kogito-bom</artifactId>
+        <version>${project.version}</version>
+        <type>pom</type>
+        <scope>import</scope>
+      </dependency>
+      <!-- PMML -->
+      <dependency>
+        <groupId>org.jpmml</groupId>
+        <artifactId>pmml-model</artifactId>
+        <version>${version.org.jpmml}</version>
+      </dependency>
